The contract supports: - Batch execution of arbitrary calls - Token approvals management - Specialized futarchy operations (split/merge positions) - Integration with Swapr and Balancer execute((address,uint256,bytes)[]).details: Can only be called by the EOA itself (when using EIP-7702)

params.calls: Array of calls to execute in order

executeBuyConditional(bytes).details: Specialized function for the buy conditional flow

executeSellConditional(bytes).details: Specialized function for the sell conditional flow

executeWithResults((address,uint256,byte.details: This variant returns the results of each call for more complex arbitrage logic

returns.results: Array of return data from each call

setApprovals(address[],address[],uint256.details: Useful for setting up all necessary approvals before arbitrage operations

params.amounts: Array of amounts to approve (must match tokens length)
params.spenders: Array of spender addresses (must match tokens length)

executeWithResults((address,uint256,byte.notice: Execute a batch of calls with return value tracking

setApprovals(address[],address[],uint256.notice: Helper function to set multiple token approvals
